channel.title: Giving Ubuntu a try
channel.description: I got tired of Windows and decided to give Ubuntu a try. Right now I'm liking it so far, but the terminal looks hella confusing. Can anyone explain how it all works? Sorry if I'm asking something retarded, I don't know lol.

item.title: Giving Ubuntu a try
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

Spades:

Ubuntu is a great OS, I use it a lot at work and have grown to really enjoy it. The terminal has become my best friend, I can do most things faster through terminal than I could with a standard GUI.

I second this, I have used Ubuntu since only November last year and love it.

Read full topic

item.title: Giving Ubuntu a try
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:4, topic:551059”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=669973.msg4479916#msg4479916 date=1428880180]

I got tired of Windows and decided to give Ubuntu a try.
Right now I’m liking it so far, but the terminal looks hella confusing. Can anyone explain how it all works?
Sorry if I’m asking something retarded, I don’t know lol.

Once you learn how to use a terminal well it’s absolutely fantastic to use. I learned how to take advantage of it in one of my CS courses and I use it to do almost everything. There are a lot of tutorials and UNIX shell references online to get you started.
[/quote]
Alright thanks man.[/quote]

I forgot to mention that your default shell is probably bash. You can always change to a different one if you would prefer.

Read full topic

Imagine the terminal is the windows command prompt but a lot more powerful and a lot more important.
